isis.stitle: 9 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT-8609 SERIES - REMOVE - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT BEARINGS

step1.para: Remove the snap ring in the rear bearing bore of the case ( Figure 62).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Remove Snap Ring in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul against the rear of the countershaft to move the assembly forward as far as possible until the snap ring groove in the front bearing is exposed ( Figure 63).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Move Assembly Forward as Far as Possible

note.para: If the front bearing snap ring groove cannot be exposed (due to variances in the thickness of the case), use a punch between the hub of the countershaft drive gear and the inner race of the bearing to move the bearing forward on the shaft.

step1.para: Install the snap ring that was removed from the rear bearing bore in the exposed snap ring groove ( Figure 64).
Use a soft bar and maul to drive each countershaft to the rear as far as possible ( Figure 65). This will move the front bearing forward on the countershaft.

figure.caption: Figure 65. Drive Each Countershaft to Rear as Far as Possible

step1.para: From the case rear, use a soft bar and maul to drive the countershaft forward to unseat the front bearing from the case bore ( Figure 66).

figure.caption: Figure 66. Drive Countershaft Forward to Unseat Front Bearing

note.para: This procedure may have to be repeated several times to unseat the front bearing.

step1.para: Use a bearing puller or pry bars to remove the countershaft front bearing ( Figure 67).
Block the countershaft and use a maul and punch from inside the case to drive the rear countershaft bearing from the case bore and countershaft ( Figure 68).

figure.caption: Figure 68. Drive Rear Countershaft Bearing From Case Bore

caution.para: Removal procedures will damage the bearings. Removal should not be attempted unless replacement of the bearings is planned.
